result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

NG plea entered.

9:23 AM Defendant Emmanuel J Ortiz in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Emmanuel J Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. Defense asks for a bond modification in 22CF845 with argument. State objects. BTC: Bond modification granted to a $2000 cash bond in case 22CF845 and a $3000 signature bond, It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive unless properly licensed. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:37 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Emmanuel J Ortiz in court.  Attorney John E. German in court for Emmanuel J Ortiz. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense moves to dismiss bail jumping counts.
State objects with argument.
BTC: Motion to dismiss denied. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
